metadata.Title: CVE-2015-20107 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
In Python (aka CPython) up to 3.10.8, the mailcap module does not addescape characters into commands discovered in the system mailcap file. Thismay allow attackers to inject shell commands into applications that callmailcap.findmatch with untrusted input (if they lack validation ofuser-provided filenames or arguments). The fix is also back-ported to 3.7,3.8, 3.9

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-20107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm11').
python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm13').
python3.5 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
